title.narrative: OUTPUT 1: RENFORCEMENT INSTITUTIONNEL

description.narrative: By 2016, mechanisms to promote access for all children aged 0-14, including opportunities for early childhood development and quality basic education are in place, as well as to improve the efficiency of governance at central and local levels., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, girls and boys aged 0-14 years in the three poorest quintiles benefit from education policies to ensure equitable access to quality basic education and opportunities for early childhood development.

actual.value: 2016:N/AExplanation: Not available. No accreditation work by MoE.

title.narrative: % of girls and boys, including those with disabilities, have access to basic education

actual.value: 2016:Value : 82.3%Explanation:source OOSC Report, 2016 (based on School census data)

title.narrative: Status of promulgation of the law on the National Education Fund and its application so that all schools (regular and specialized) have access.

actual.value: 2016:No.Explanation: Law is on hold at parliament. Both the National Office for Partnership in Education is now functional and is responsible for overseeing the law.

title.narrative: Existence of a mechansim of prevention of gender-base violence, those against children with disabilities and other types of violence, and protection mechanisms in schools

actual.value: 2016:YesExplanation: Ministry developed the Code of Conduct against violence in schools (which should have been validated by end October). Pilot testing of activities to prevent violence in schools have been carried out in Southeast department, benefiting around 5,000 children.

title.narrative: Existence of an operational, regularly updated system for collecting routine data on the education system is in all school districts
